commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: skeletal version that can interact with user
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class only prints out DUKE output and does not take in input.

The class now greets the user, echoes the input commands, and exits upon "bye".

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to store user input
commitResults.messageBody: Storing the input allows us to print all the items entered back so that the user is reminded of what they need. Using an arraylist is beneficial compared to an array as we are unsure of how long the users input will be.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement feature to mark status of tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
The list offers no tracking ability of the items. Doing so would allow us to enhance user experience.

let's create a new class to store the information of a task (e.g. details and status).

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for tracking 3 types of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
The 3 types of tasks have common behaviors and so inherit from the Task.
- Deadline
- Event
- ToDo

Let's create more detailed levels of tasks to allow users more options when using Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test using the I/O redirection technique
commitResults.messageBody: Let's automate testing to confirm there are no regressions and to observe changes in the program behavior more easily.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement custom exception for error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's handle the following possible user error:
- unknown command given
- missing date for events/deadlines
- missing description for events/deadlines/todos

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant code and add exception case
commitResults.messageBody: New case of error handling where the user marks/unmarks a non-existent task number

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for deleting tasks from the list
commitResults.messageBody: User can now delete tasks from the list using the "delete" command. Error handling implemented should they delete a non-existent task.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add function for I/O operations to save tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Let's allow users to store the list of tasks so they can access it without using the app

commitResults.messageTitle: Add understanding of dates for tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Tasks with dates such as deadlines and events will be required to follow a strict format of yyyy-mm-dd.

commitResults.messageTitle: Format code and bug fix
commitResults.messageBody:
Fixed bug where commands were not being saved to the file despite changes to the list.
Reformatted code to adhere to code standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code for OOP purposes
commitResults.messageBody:
New classes have been added to extract different functionalities from Duke. They are mainly the
- Storage: deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
- TaskMaster: holds the list of tasks for the user, and has operations to edit the list
- Ui: deals with interactions with the user, focusing on taking in input and sending output
- Parser: deals with understanding the user's input, and reacts accordingly with the appropriate command
- Command: abstract class that deals with executing the appropriate actions to handle the input

The Command class has the following children:
- AddCommand: deals with creating and adds tasks to the taskMaster and storage.
- ExitCommand: ends the program and exits
- DeleteCommand: deletes the given task from taskMaster and saves to storage
- ListCommand: lists out the tasks in taskMaster
- MarkCommand: marks and unmarks tasks in taskMaster

commitResults.messageTitle: Organize classes into packages
Add JUnit Tests
commitResults.messageBody: Add tests to test the behavior of the code for Parser and Ui.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments
commitResults.messageBody: Header comments added to all non-private classes/methods

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to comply with CS2103 coding standard
Add functionality to allow users to find tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Given a keyword, Duke can locate the tasks that contain this keyword in their description.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add comments for those that were missed out on the previous commit
- Edit naming of some variables to adhere to code standard
- Fixed minor bugs

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove extra lines in code
Automate project builds using Gradle
